climbs.name: Swing Shift
climbs.fa: Pam Neal and Ben Chapman, July 17, 2020

content.description: The start is a bit tricky, but with a good spot no big deal. Great pockets follow a corner system. Fun stemming moves get you out of the corner and on the slab to the climber's left.
content.location: Located 10 ft. right of Nightshift, on the south facing buttress of the Hatchery. Shady all morning, full sun in the afternoon.

content.description:
Eager Beaver

climbs the cavernous overhang on the west face of the Hatchery.

Scramble up the right side of the slab to a spaceous ledge below the overhang.

Climb up into the cave on a

fist

jam in a pocket, a horizontal rail, and an undercling from a formidable fang of conglomate, to a bomber pocket above the lip. Continue up on large pockets and features to a final commiting reach to a pocket and the anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts (2 of which are permadraws) & anchor with chains.
content.location: West face of the Hatchery, 30 feet left of "Party Like A Rock Scar." Look for two permadraws in the overhanging cave.

content.description: The left side of the Working Wall Buttress has a steep bulge festooned with very large course blocks. Boulder up the blocks to reach a large smooth projecting cobble. Yard up on the smooth cobble and a side pull to reach a black jug and pull through a vertical section. Climb up and left through cobbles and pockets as the exposure increases. From a stance upon a large course grained orange block climb through nice cobbles and pockets to the anchor. Mind the fall line on descent/rappel as descending the route line can result in an unpleasant pendulum.
content.location: On the south face of the Hatchery, at the left side of the buttress. Eight feet left of Night Shift.
